column3:
This is not the right direction. You're combining network, wallet, blockchain database, verification constants all into one header file, where we plan to modularize stuff.

I'm all for eliminating magic numbers, but please put the constants in their own localized header files (that already exist, no need to make a new one).

Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/4c8212802c5900158d03c749667dc6adef48a618 for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/cu
@laanwj Well, I for sure can put the constants in the corresponding header files, but then optionsmodel.cpp for example will include all these to access the constants, right?\n
Closing this for now as I don't like the idea of centralization into a single header. If you want to clean up magic values in some other way, please open a new pull.\n
